intro: Isnardia hastata, commonly known as the narrowleaf watercress, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, alternate leaves that are typically lance-shaped. Its flowers are white or pale yellow, arranged in racemes, and it produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, aquatic or semi-aquatic environments, often found in streams and wet meadows.
